docs.snippet: MADISON, Wis., March 1 (UPI) -- Gail Goodrich made a 15-foot jump shot with five seconds left to give the Los Angeles Lakers a 109-108 victory over the Milwaukee Bucks tonight in a game between the National Basketball Association's top two teams....
docs.lead_paragraph: MADISON, Wis., March 1 (UPI) -- Gail Goodrich made a 15-foot jump shot with five seconds left to give the Los Angeles Lakers a 109-108 victory over the Milwaukee Bucks tonight in a game between the National Basketball Association's top two teams.

headline.main: Lakers Set Back Bucks On Late Shot, 109 to 108

docs.snippet: ANT ART More than 2 million ants, surely the most grandiose cast in town, are the stars of "Army Ants: Patterns and Structures," Alan Sonfist's exhibition now running, actually running, around a large rectangular enclosure that fills a first floor...
docs.lead_paragraph: ANT ART More than 2 million ants, surely the most grandiose cast in town, are the stars of "Army Ants: Patterns and Structures," Alan Sonfist's exhibition now running, actually running, around a large rectangular enclosure that fills a first floor room at Automation House, 49 East 68th Street.

docs.snippet: LORADO, W. Va., Feb. 29 -- As far as Oscar McComas Sr. could see, the Buffalo Creek hollow was one big tangle of mud and upturned cars and timber today. But the retired miner talked like a civic booster in any small town as he pointed his finger a...
docs.lead_paragraph: LORADO, W. Va., Feb. 29 -- As far as Oscar McComas Sr. could see, the Buffalo Creek hollow was one big tangle of mud and upturned cars and timber today. But the retired miner talked like a civic booster in any small town as he pointed his finger at the coal-laden hills and said: "We'll come back. Miners always do."

headline.main: Miners Cling to Homes That Are Left After Flood

byline.original: By GEORGE VECSEYSpecial to The New York Times

headline.main: GEORGE' RICHARD,, BROKER, 79, DEAD; A Founder of Lo Pavilion Began Festival Theater.

docs.snippet: HAIFA, Israel, Feb. 27 -- For 35-year-old Allen Reiter it was a chance to make his personal mark in developing Israel's computer systems, instead of holding down a job in the United States where he would be just one highly skilled specialist among...
docs.lead_paragraph: HAIFA, Israel, Feb. 27 -- For 35-year-old Allen Reiter it was a chance to make his personal mark in developing Israel's computer systems, instead of holding down a job in the United States where he would be just one highly skilled specialist among many others.
docs.abstract: Article on how 3,000 highly skilled American technicians and scientists, who have immigrated to Israel since '67 war, are important assets for developing country's long-range potential; Israel's investment in scientific education and research is soaring; cutbacks and lay-offs in US science-based industries prodded many to emigrate; experiences of A Reiter, computer expert, Prof H Wolff, rocket propulsion expert, and O Pinkus, aeronautical engineer, discussed

byline.original: By PETER GROSESpecial to The New York Times

docs.snippet: In 1952, writing in praise of David Riesman's "The Lonely Crowd," Lionel Trilling remarked that contemporary social science was developing an increasingly acute and subtle "sense of social actuality" which contemporary literature sadly lacked. Ind...
docs.lead_paragraph: In 1952, writing in praise of David Riesman's "The Lonely Crowd," Lionel Trilling remarked that contemporary social science was developing an increasingly acute and subtle "sense of social actuality" which contemporary literature sadly lacked. Indeed, sociology seemed to be "in the process of taking over from literature one of literature's most characteristic functions, the investigation and criticism of morals and manners."
docs.abstract: Goffman, Erving: Book Relations in Public. Microstudies in Public Order by E Goffman revd by M Berman

headline.main: Relations in Public; Microstudies in Public Order. By Erving Goffman. 396 pp. New York: Basic Books. $7.95.
